title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:39 <@cjdelisle> tekzilla: blog and sandbox should be removable, not entirely sure about scheduler, deleting XWiki is like deleting C:\Windows  
08:55 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <vmassol> has quit  
10:15 <asyd> hi there  
10:15 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
10:16 <asyd> I create my own planed by adding a page in Panels with class Panels.PanelsClass however it doesn't appear in the PanelsWizard  
10:17 <@cjdelisle> have you tried asking on the mailing list?  
10:17 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <asyd> not yet :)  
10:39 <tekzilla> cjdelisle: thanks, do i really have to remove all pages to remove a space ?  
10:41 <tekzilla> as a non-admin i only see blog, invitation and sandbox btw so its not as crowded anyway  
10:42 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <@cjdelisle> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Delete+Space  
10:46 <@cjdelisle> be careful  
10:46 <@cjdelisle> invitation can be deleted safely  
11:02 <tekzilla> nice, that worked very well  
11:06 <tekzilla> well ok it didnt work for the sandbox  
11:07 <@cjdelisle> sandbox didn't delete?  
11:09 <tekzilla> unfortunately not. the first run looked ok but now he just lists the root page several times  
11:10 <@cjdelisle> Sandbox.WebHome?  
11:10 <tekzilla> yes  
11:10 <@cjdelisle> did you try deleting it manually?  
11:11 <@cjdelisle> "several times" --> in a multilingual wiki, each translation is a distinct document.  
11:13 <tekzilla> ok it seems sandboxes WebHome is undeletable  
11:13 <tekzilla> he cant locate it anymore, but it shows up in the document index  
11:13 <tekzilla> i restored it once and deleted it manually again, same result  
11:14 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <tekzilla> oh theres even an FAQ entry about this, and it also recommends the Delete Space extension  
11:17 <@cjdelisle> {{groovy}} println(xwiki.searchDocuments("where doc.space = 'Sandbox'")) {{/groovy}}  
11:18 <@cjdelisle> {{groovy}} println(xwiki.search("select doc.fullname, doc.language from XWikiDocument doc where doc.space = 'Sandbox'")) {{/groovy}}  
11:22 <tekzilla> the first one prints out: [Sandbox.WebHome]  
11:22 <tekzilla> i'm afraid the second one wont run  
11:26 <@cjdelisle> {{groovy}} println("{{{" + xwiki.search("select doc.fullName, doc.language from XWikiDocument doc where doc.space = 'Sandbox'") + "}}}") {{/groovy}}  
11:28 <tekzilla> ah yes it lists Sandbox.WebHome for several languages  
11:32 <lucaa> has quit  
11:41 <tekzilla> thanks very much for the help so far, need to take a break over here

15:37 <StefanM> ok  
15:37 <StefanM> can anyone help me setup xwiki  
15:37 <StefanM> i seem to be running around in cirlces for the past couple of hours :)  
15:41 <@cjdelisle> what are you stuck on?  
15:42 <StefanM> well  
15:42 <StefanM> i checked out the svn  
15:42 <StefanM> (hopefully the proper one this time)  
15:42 <StefanM> and when runnning mvn install  
15:42 <@cjdelisle> you trying to install or compile?  
15:42 <StefanM> to compile\*  
15:42 <StefanM> on ubuntu  
15:43 <@cjdelisle> You read the page on building xwiki?  
15:43 <Shravan> has joined #xwiki  
15:46 <StefanM> i guess there will be on the 23rd or 25th  
15:47 <Shravan> StefanM, ok got it  
15:47 <@cjdelisle> no news that I know of. BTW coming out and asking questions in irc is fine. Just ask and wait (and wait and wait and sometimes wait some more) then ask again ;)  
16:11 <mar3lis> has joined #xwiki  
16:26 <supreet> has quit  
17:09 <StefanM> guys, isn't there an easier faster way of having a xwiki setup on ubuntu than going through all the turmoil of compiling it using maven and trying to figure out all the errors ?:)  
17:09 <Shravan> Shravan, can we package xwiki ?  
17:09 <@cjdelisle> just download it and run it?  
17:10 <@cjdelisle> !search download xwiki  
17:10 <Shravan> cjdelisle, Is there a package for xwiki ?  
17:10 <@cjdelisle> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download  
17:10 <@cjdelisle> that^  
17:11 <StefanM> ok, lol  
17:12 <StefanM> that's ... easier :)  
17:12 <StefanM> tks  
17:20 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
17:37 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <asyd> hey, I'm wondering if there is a macro/snippet/whatever to display the list of documents in a space  
17:38 <asyd> with the hierarchy (sub folders, etc)  
17:40 <vmassol> asyd: yep, see extensions.xwiki.org  
17:41 <asyd> well, there are so many (interesting) stuff in extensions  
17:41 <vmassol> asyd: search "tree" maybe  
17:41 <vmassol> in the livetable  
17:41 <vmassol> in the name column  
17:42 <vmassol> note: there might oldish stuff  
17:42 <asyd> this one http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Plugin?  
17:42 <vmassol> you can also search on "space"  
17:42 <vmassol> this one is easy but not hierarchical: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/SpaceIndex+Macro  
17:43 <vmassol> this one looks nice: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Space+Explorer+Panel+Application  
17:43 <asyd> I need the hierachy  
17:44 <asyd> ah, this one looks good  
17:44 <vmassol> if you need it in a page you can copypaste the content of the panel  
17:54 <StefanM> ok, this might sound like a stupid question, but where is the default address/port of the new xwiki installation  
17:55 <@cjdelisle> 8080  
17:55 <@cjdelisle> 127.0.0.1  
17:56 <StefanM> tks

18:10 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
18:10 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
18:12 <mar3lis> if i have a class, and created a document of that class. how can i set values to that document without going to the edit mode  
18:12 <mar3lis> ?  
18:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:12 <@cjdelisle> You don't create a document of a class, you create an object which you attach to a document.  
18:13 <mar3lis> sorry  
18:13 <mar3lis> yes  
18:13 <mar3lis> how can i change the values of the object without going to the edit mode  
18:14 <mar3lis> maybe by pressing just some link  
18:14 <@cjdelisle> Editing the object programmaticly?  
18:14 <mar3lis> ?  
18:14 <mar3lis> yes  
18:14 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting#HBindings  
18:14 <StefanM> has quit  
18:14 <@cjdelisle> use the $xwiki binding and call getDocument() on it to load the document, then once oyu have the document, getXObject() and with the object you can manipulate it.  
18:15 <@cjdelisle> Those links will point you to javadoc documents which explain how to do it.  
18:15 <@cjdelisle> Remember, once you're done you have to save the document which contains the object.  
18:15 <mar3lis> #save  
18:15 <mar3lis> ?  
18:17 <@cjdelisle> saveAsAuthor() will put the name of the script author on the document (nice if the user is not permitted to save that document)  
18:17 <jvdrean> has quit  
18:17 <@cjdelisle> save() will save in the user/viewer's name.  
18:18 <mar3lis> ok thank you  
18:18 <@cjdelisle> sure  
18:19 <mar3lis> and about the permission rights, i can make that the viewer cannot edit surten pages, but in he presses a specific link, he can add him self to some page  
18:19 <mar3lis> ?  
18:19 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
18:19 <@cjdelisle> yes, using saveAsAuthor()  
18:19 <mar3lis> thank you :)

20:48 <Chami2> has quit  
20:51 <@cjdelisle> hey, bblfish hows it going?  
20:52 <bblfish> hi, good  
20:52 <bblfish> working on http://webid.info/spec/  
20:52 <bblfish> got to go watch the watering of garden...  
20:52 <@cjdelisle> ahh  
20:53 <@cjdelisle> I've been tinkering with a dns system based on dht.  
20:55 <bblfish> dht?  
20:56 <@cjdelisle> distributed hash tables  
20:57 <@cjdelisle> everyone generates a random id number and then the keys they're responsable for are the ones closest to their id number.  
20:57 <@cjdelisle> So if you're looking for a record you just ask whoever uyou know who's id is closest to the record and they ask whoever they know etc.  
20:58 <bblfish> I wrote something on how one could use public key based URLs to do some interesting thing  
20:58 <bblfish> s  
20:59 <@cjdelisle> yea, a public key fp in a subdomain is good.  
20:59 <bblfish> if one does not care about readable urls then some interesting things are surely possible  
21:00 <@cjdelisle> I was thinking about doing a pastebin with client side crypto.  
21:00 <@cjdelisle> javascript aes or something and just use ur anchor for the key.  
21:01 <bblfish> got to switch off the water  
21:02 <@cjdelisle> k
